name: Marta Kryven
content: Marta Kryven Marta Kryven Assistant professor at Dalhousie University I am a computational cognitive scientist working with AI and experimental psychology. I study intelligence as computation, to gain insight into human cognition and advance AI. Check out my Google Scholar to learn more. I have a number of projects on standby for talented undergraduate and graduate students - send us your CV and project suggestion to get in touch. Consulting AI and Cognition: modelling behaviour, AI system audit and design, cognitive interpretability, VC technical dilligence for AI. Data science: helping bussinesses transform data-sets into actionable insights. Research interests computational cognitive science, spatial navigation, representation learning, program induction, agentic AI Selected Publications , (link) , , Media How the brain navigates cities (MIT News) Our project with Nikolaos Vlavianos on how people experience immersion in virtual spaces
